If you look at the pdf for the goodie bag it tells us the thickness is 0.005 inches and density for copper is 8.94 g/cm^3.  Then you need to convert the inches to cm and use the periodic table for molar mass of copper.  With a little math you get an answer.
neglected the thickness.

Google "mol" (chemistry). You don't use ruler to calculate number of atoms in copper. You get it's weigh and use it's "mol" weight, to actually get amount of atoms. It would be nice if they would actually clarify what they've meant when they was talking about the ruler.
